Description: Two fragments of an ostracon belonging to the same pottery vessel, a wine jar in Marl D or imported fabric, but do not join directly. The larger fragment: The pottery sherd is sub-rectangular in shape, broken off at the bottom. There are three lines of hieratic text written in black ink, with the third verse of the teaching of Amenemhat on it. 1) sDr.k{w Hr}-sA[w ...] 2) Ds=k Hr-ntj-nn-w[n ...] 3) sj hrw [nt(?)]-qsn[t ...] 1) You should sleep with your own [heart] 2) watch[ing over you] / for there will be no [supporters for] 3) a man / on the day [of(?)] pai[n ...] The smaller fragment is glued together from three small pieces. Remains of two lines of hieratic text joining the previous fragment with a small gap in between, written in black ink. A possible third line on the inside (?).
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), larger fragment: E14.6 outside E14.13, upper level; the smaller fragment was recovered from the redim tip
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 65, 68)
